com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.locking.consistentkey

Class ExpectedValueCheckingTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.locking.consistentkey.ExpectedValueCheckingTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StoreTransaction, TransactionHandle

    public class ExpectedValueCheckingTransaction
extends Object
implements StoreTransaction
    A StoreTransaction that supports locking via LocalLockMediator and writing and reading lock records in a ExpectedValueCheckingStore.

    This class is not safe for concurrent use by multiple threads. Multithreaded access must be prevented or externally synchronized.

    • Field Summary

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Commits the transaction. This implies a TransactionHandle.flush(). Call either this method or TransactionHandle.rollback() at most once per instance.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Forces all buffered writes to be sent to underlying storage. It is not necessary or meaningful to call this method on a TransactionHandle instance after calling TransactionHandle.commit() or TransactionHandle.rollback() on the instance.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface TransactionHandle
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • isMutationStarted

        public boolean isMutationStarted()
        Tells whether this transaction has been used in a ExpectedValueCheckingStore.mutate(StaticBuffer, List, List, StoreTransaction) call. When this returns true, the transaction is no longer allowed in calls to ExpectedValueCheckingStore.acquireLock(StaticBuffer, StaticBuffer, StaticBuffer, StoreTransaction).
        Returns:
        False until ExpectedValueCheckingStore.mutate(StaticBuffer, List, List, StoreTransaction) is called on this transaction instance. Returns true forever after.

      • mutationStarted

        public void mutationStarted()
        Signals the transaction that it has been used in a call to ExpectedValueCheckingStore.mutate(StaticBuffer, List, List, StoreTransaction) . This transaction can't be used in subsequent calls to ExpectedValueCheckingStore.acquireLock(StaticBuffer, StaticBuffer, StaticBuffer, StoreTransaction) .

        Calling this method at the appropriate time is handled automatically by ExpectedValueCheckingStore. Titan users don't need to call this method by hand.

      • getConfiguration

        public StoreTxConfig getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: StoreTransaction
        Get the configuration for this transaction
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface StoreTransaction
        Returns:
